Derwent victorious in scrappy Goodricke encounter

An under-strength Derwent side claimed victory over Goodricke in a scrappy game on Sunday

James bounce back to take win

After both teams suffered heavy defeats in last week's opening round of games this term, it was James who bounced back the strongest with some exquisite attacking play that ran the Langwith defence ragged in a chilly encounter on the 3G on Sunday

Wentworth win again to keep top spot

Wentworth College are now two games unbeaten and top of the table after defeating Alcuin in a scrappy game on 22 Acres

We all dreamt of a team of Carraghers

As Jamie Carragher announces his retirement, Beth Jakubowski pays tribute to one of Liverpool's greatest players

Men's lacrosse defeat Durham in close encounter

Revenge was sweet for the White Rose's men's lacrosse team as they narrowly defeated Durham to advance to the semi finals of the BUCS Cup - beating the side that knocked York out of the final last year

York battle through horror conditions to reach semi-finals

A brace of goals from Sam Barker and one apiece from Jess Craig and Ellie Whittaker ensured York a 4-2 victory over Leeds in the quarter finals of the BUCS Cup today in the face of atrocious conditions on 22 acres

Rugby firsts battle to convincing Leeds win

The men's rugby firsts braved the arctic conditions on 22 Acres this afternoon to record a vital 41-10 victory over Leeds seconds

Classy Vanbrugh upstage Goodricke

Vanbrugh opened their account for 2013 with a victory after beating opponents Goodricke 2-0 on 22 Acres this morning

Derwent brush aside old rivals Langwith

The long awaited return of college football on 22 Acres was greeted with a frenzy of goals as the University's two oldest colleges reignited their old rivalry

Wentworth hit James for six in Spring opener

Wentworth got their Spring Term campaign off to a dream start in a 6-1 demolition of James College on 22 Acres

Returning Halifax rocked by late Alcuin strike

A late goal from Andy Fernando condemned Halifax to a shock defeat in their first college football match of the year on the 3G Pitch this morning

Incredible women's lacrosse firsts destroy Liverpool

The women's lacrosse team put on a scintillating performance of pure poetry and technical brilliance to crush Liverpool 20-2 in the first round of the BUCS Cup on Saturday

York Sailing prepare for national qualifiers

By James Bithell

Both of York Sailing's teams have been putting in the hours in the last few weeks despite the horrendous weather in order to prepare for the upcoming BUSA Northern Qualifiers this weekend

York victorious against league leaders Sheffield

York's women's volleyball team stormed to victory in the Sports Tent yesterday as they whitewashed league leaders Sheffield

Ruthless Hull sweep past brave women's basketball firsts

The Hull women's firsts put on a fabulous display of physical basketball this afternoon as they ran out comprehensive 60-36 winners, despite a fantastic effort from a youthful York side

York charge to top of the league with crushing victory

York's women's footballers enjoyed a crushing victory on a wet and windy 22 Acres this afternoon against Newcastle. They made the most of the atrocious weather to romp to an 11-0 win with standout performances from strikers Amy Johnson and Jess Craig who each bagged a hat-trick

UYAFC triumph over Trinity to stay top

In horrendous conditions on the 3G Pitch, the men's firsts football team came from a goal down to beat Leeds Trinity and maintain their promotion push

Zidane the greatest of all time

Jules Delay weighs in on the 'Greatest Footballer of All Time' debate, making the case for French legend Zinedine Zidane

Keeping Kieswetter

After another unsuccessful tour of India, England's cricketers once again made their wicket keeping dilemma's the scape-goat for their failures. Beth Jakubowski analyses why dropping Craig Kieswetter was a poor decision from the England management

Derwent takes on Tough Guy challenge

On Sunday a team of 15 students from Derwent College submitted themselves to the inconceivably gruelling 'Tough Guy' contest in a bid to raise money for YUSU RAG

York's equestrian firsts take solid third

York's equestrian first team completed a very solid third place finish at their BUCS competition last Wednesday

Alcuin in cruise control as they sweep aside Vanbrugh

Alcuin saw off a depleted Vanbrugh side today to continue their fine start to the new term. The reigning champions fought off a five man Vanbrugh side to record a comprehensive victory

Women's fencing made to settle for second

There was disappointment for the women's fencing team this afternoon, as they were forced to settle for second place in their hunt for the Premier League title

Brutal Northumbria brush aside promising volleyball seconds

Northumbria taught the young but valiant men's volleyball seconds a lesson yesterday as they dismantled York in straight sets

York fall to Leeds Met defeat

York's netballers fell to a 10 goal defeat to strong Leeds Met side today in the Sports Tent. A rapid and evenly matched game saw Leeds Met just edge what was a close encounter against a weakened York side

Badminton seconds narrowly miss promotion

A smashing performance from the ladies badminton seconds team was not enough to brush aside the league leaders, York St John firsts. A win would have given the side promotion in the BUCS league, leapfrogging their opponents

Second team prevail in badminton clash

The men's badminton seconds came out on top in an all-York encounter that saw them beat the third team 6-2 this afternoon

Changing Gear

As part of a '2012 Effect' series, Beth Jakubowski speaks to Jess Taylor, Cycling Club President, about the 2012 legacy and its impact on grassroots sport.

Futsal firsts crowned champions

The men's firsts futsal team enjoyed an epic win with three goals in the final three minutes, to stun a physical Sheffield Hallam side and claim an historic BUCS Northern Premier League in emphatic style on Friday night

York teams looking for BUCS boost

Should the somewhat hostile weather conditions subside by tomorrow afternoon, York's teams will be hoping to kick-start their spring term in the BUCS leagues
